title: Terror of the Sontarans
author: John Dorney & Dan Starkey
filename: 203 - Terror of the Sontarans - John Dorney & Dan Starkey_djvu.txt

elements.text: PART ONE
SCENE 1: INT. OBSERVATION DOME
(SILENCE. A PLASMA BLASTER ECHOES AROUND A LARGE EMPTY ROOM. WE
BREATHING IN THE FOREGROUND. ANOTHER PLASMA BLAST
(LOW, HOARSE LAUGHTER. WHISPER) So many colours! So bright
and...
(ANOTHER BLAST. AS THE ECHO SUBSIDES, THE BLASTER’S POWER PACK
IT IS LOW ON CHARGE - A DESCENDING TONE)
(DELIGHTED LAUGHTER) Do you see that? Do you see? Just one
more...
(A FINAL, WEAKER PLASMA BLAST ECHOES AROUND THE ROOM. THEN THE
BEING PULLED IN VAIN)
Beautiful... So beautiful. All gone now. Still you watch...
(THE BLASTER CLATTERS AS IT’S TOSSED ASIDE. FOOTSTEPS RECEDE INTO THE DISTANCE, THE VOICE GOING WITH THEM)
(OFF TO FADE) All gone... All gone... Alone... All gone...
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 3
SCENE 2: INT. BASE UPPER LEVEL
THE TARDIS MATERIALISES. THE DOCTOR STEPS OUT
Hello! Anyone home?
MEL EXITS BEHIND HIM AND CLOSES THE DOOR
Doctor! Are you sure that’s a good idea?
What, saying hello? Of course. One should always be polite.
I meant shouting out. Surely it’s sensible to be cautious?
When have I ever been cautious?
Distress beacons do tend to suggest that someone’s, well... in
distress. I’m perfectly happy to help, obviously, but I’m not awfully keen to join them.
Ah, but a distress beacon also suggests that whoever launched it had enough time to launch a distress beacon. If they managed
that, then we’ll have the time to run away. Should we need it. Should anything untoward happen.
You do realise that isn’t a comfort, don’t you?
No-one’s come to kill us yet, so we’re doing alright for now.
They could have attached a message. Given us a clue. (BEAT)
Place seems deserted. It’s all rather dark.
But I can still see you... meaning there’s a light source in the next room! (HE HEADS OUT. SHE FOLLOWS...)
... BUT A DERANGED SONTARAN - STOD - SHUFFLES BEHIND THEM
SNUFFLING
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 4
SCENE 3: INT. OBSERVATION DOME
MEL ENTERS AND IMMEDIATELY STOPS
Wow.
Yes, it’s obvious why someone put a transparent dome on the top level, rather than walls and a ceiling. What a spectacular view.
What are those? Dust clouds?
Of the most iridescent kind.
Shame the surface is so barren.
Oh, I don’t know, Mel. I think the contrast between the rocks and the sky is what makes the ensemble work. Like Sydney Harbour. I never can choose between the Opera House and the Bridge.
Actually, it’s not all that barren, if you look. All those multi-coloured patches on the ground.
Yes. Lichen or seaweed, maybe? Must be humid out there.
Those sculptures are odd, though.
Sculptures?
Those sculptures. Behind us?
Oh. I was distracted by the view. Why odd? They look roughly human. More so than many sculptures you have on Earth.
I’m not talking about the design. I mean their being here at all. Why bother putting sculptures in a room with a view like that? Who’s going to look at them?
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 5
Maybe someone got bored of the sky. If you saw it every day, you might take it for granted too.
I just think you'd put them somewhere else. (BEAT) So could we go outside?
Not with those clouds out there. I rather suspect they’d be inimical to human life, despite their beauty. The atmosphere’s
probably breathable, just about. But on balance... not the most hospitable environment.
Then we might as well press on.
(TURNING) Yes, I think that’s the — (BREAKS OFF) Now that is odd.
What is?
These glass panels. Do they look discoloured to you?
Perhaps a bit.
(HE WANDERS OVER) If I didn’t know better, I’d say that was typically the result of laser fire.
What, from a laser gun?
Or some kind of energy weapon, certainly. (TOUCHES GLASS) Cool
to the touch. The damage isn’t very recent.
Yes, but if someone’s been shooting a laser gun in here...
It is rather worrying, isn’t it? Come on.
(THEY HEAD OUT. AS THEY DO, CROSS OVER TO STOD SNUFFLING IN THE
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 6
SNUFFLING
(OFF) Awfully dark through here.
(OFF) Good job I spotted the light switch, then.
(OFF, HE FLICKS A HEFTY CONTROL. A WHIRR OF POWER. THE WHOLE
LIGHTS UP. THE LIGHTS FLICKER AND SPARK A BIT. AT THIS: )
ALARMED, SHUFFLES AWAY
CROSS BACK TO:
Did I say light switch? I meant auxiliary power controls.
Not the most consistent power supply, is it? Oh, well, it’s better than - (STOPS) Doctor - did something move over there?
Back towards the TARDIS?
It’s your imagination. Come on.
THEY EXIT
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 7
SCENE 4: INT. CELLS
(SMALL CLANKING NOISE AND A GRIND OF GEARS. ON VARIOUS CELL DOORS, SERVING HATCHES OPEN. THE CHARACTERS CALL OUT FROM
DIFFERENT DOORS THROUGHOUT, SPREAD OUT, AND UNTIL
THEY'RE RELEASED IN LATER SCENES)
(CALLING OUT) Hello! Hello? Can anyone hear me?
(CALLING OUT) That you, Clown?
Clown? Mr Ketch to you, sonny Jim. And yes, it is me.
Obviously. You’re still in there, Jackson?
Feels like it.
Good to hear. Well, looks like it’s feeding time. At last. If they’ve unlocked the service hatches...
I’d rather they’d have unlocked the doors.
Prisoners can’t be choosers. Look on the bright side. Bit of fresh air at last... Although they’re taking their time to dish up. I have to say the service here’s been terrible. Not even two star...
How about the others? Are they still locked up?
Can’t you tell? I thought your cell had a good view.
If I could see them, d’you think I’d be asking? They haven’t put the lights on... Can you use any of your, ah... talents?
(SIGHS) You know, I’1l have to start charging my full fee for this. Now... (SOUNDS OF HIS LIMBS CONTORTING THEMSELVES) I’11
stretch meself up to the grille and have a shufti. (EFFORT) Hello? Miss Tethneka? Mr Stettimer? Are you there?
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 8
Oi! Lobster, rouse yourself.
ROARING, BEHIND DOOR, FROM DISTANT THROUGHOUT
Oh, he’s up then. — Tethneka!
Mother Superior! You still with us?
ROARS AGAIN. THUMPS THE WALLS OF HIS CELL
Yes, we know you're there, Lobster, my dear. That much is obvious. — Tethneka!
SILENCE
No answer. She’s dead! She’s got to be dead. Those monsters! Ohh, when I get out [of here...]
Don’t be presumptuous. She may be meditating. Not much else to do in the dark, is there?
I suppose not. And she does do that, doesn’t she?
Indeed she does. Whereas me... well, I had a kip for a while
myself, but hunger pangs woke me up. Don’t mind telling you I’m quite famished.
You've been in solitary too?
Think we all have, by the sounds of it. Our friend Mr Stettimer
appears quite agitated...
(ROARS) I am tired of this waiting! Is this another of your tests, [egg-men]?
Hello, Mr Stettimer! Let’s hope not.
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 9
Yeah, hold your horses, Lobster old boy. We don’t know what they’ve got in store next.
You do not command me, humans!
Human, is it? You flatter.
Nor our captors! I am Archon Stettimer. Do you hear? Stettimer!
Oh, here he goes...
Sing along if you know this one, ladies and gents.
(INTONING/RECITING) Stettimer long in the cavern waited/ Broad his shell and sharp his claws/ Great his valour Prince unconquered/ Praise his name across the stars!
(HE CONTINUES THE LITANY OF HIS ANCESTORS AND PACES AROUND HIS CELL. THE OTHER TWO CONTINUE THEIR DISCUSSION OVER THE TOP)

(UNDER) Spawn of Hordimer, lord of the five worlds/ Dark his eyes and deep his grasp/ Crushed his enemies’ shells beneath him/ Lead his hoplites near and far! Grand Duke Aktimer, good in the war-cry/ Long his breath and hard his shell/ Carved his rule with a thousand sword-strokes/ Sent his enemies down to Hell. Wise Old Vortimer, Best of Generals/ Stiff of joint but bright of mind/ Armies fled in fear before him/ Lead his troops
and held the line...
Oh well, if it keeps him happy.
What are they planning? Your cell still shut?
(RATTLES THE DOOR) Seems so. Looks like we’ll have to sit this one out again... until they fetch us. And then...
Hang in there, Clown. Sit tight.
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 10
Not exactly much alternative, is there?
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 11
SCENE 5: INT. STAIRWELL
THE DOCTOR AND MEL WALK ONTO A STAIRWELL
Looks like the only way is down.
Yes, the bulk of this facility must lie below that dome. Like an iceberg. Or a baked alaska.
THEY START DOWNSTAIRS
You’d think they’d provide lifts. If you’ve achieved space-travel you should be able to afford elevators.
If you’d be willing to trust them in somewhere this ramshackle.
Perhaps not. And look, more art. A mural? In a stairwell?
I can think of worse places to put a mural. It is quite the abstract, though.
Abstract? I’d say messy.
It’s a shoe-in for the Turner Prize.
THEY REACH THE NEXT LEVEL
Here we are, next level down. Blast doors.
RATTLES AN OPENING MECHANISM. IT FALLS OFF
But not the most secure variety. That was the opening mechanism.
Perhaps the blast doors got blasted?
THEY MOVE INTO THE NEXT ROOM, CRUNCHING ON GLASS
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 12
SCENE 6: INT. COMPUTER ROOM [CONTINUOUS]
(A BULB FLICKERS. THE DOCTOR AND MEL ENTER. SOME COMPUTERS RUN.
ECHOEY ROOM)
A computer room! This must be some kind of central control hub.
The terminals are working, just about. Perfect, they should tell us something about what happened here.
SHE MOVES OVER TO THE COMPUTERS, BLOWS DUST OFF THEM
If the dust hasn’t damaged them, of course.
SHE SITS AND TYPES. THE DOCTOR WANDERS
Yes, it’s everywhere, isn’t it? (SCOOPS SOME UP) Heaps of the stuff all over the place, like fine sand. (LETS IT TRICKLE
Hasn't clogged the systems, they’re running perfectly well.
(MUSING) Airlock down that corridor. For easy access to the
surface... (FINDING SOMETHING) Uniform lockers. (OPENS AND
THEM) Without uniforms. Whatever this place is, it’s very strange. An odd mix of the long-abandoned and the recently inhabited. Aha!
HE’S REACHED SOMETHING FLICKERING
Have you found something?
A kind of electronic schematic. Portable too... (TAKES IT OFF THE WALL) It appears to be the layout of the base.
Oh?
(READING) There’s a glass-domed viewing and recreation platform on the top storey -
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 13
Where we landed.
Where we landed. Then downstairs to the ground floor -
Where we are now.
Where we are now. (READING, STABBING HIS FINGER AT EACH LOCATION) Here we find power relays, equipment stores, a loading bay, a mess hall, an archive room and the Mining Computer Hub.
That last one being this room, presumably?
Apparently so. Mining, eh?
So it keeps going down then, does it, this base? Into mines?
Yes. After this floor it’s a lot of mineral labs spiralling
around a geothermal shaft. I imagine that provides energy for the base.
Not very successfully. Probably on the fritz, judging by the way the lights flicker...
It goes very deep, all the way into the cave-systems. They’re spread out far below. The whole place is built on a geological fault - for ease of access below the crust.
MEL’S COMPUTER BEEPS
Ah. I think I’ve found something myself.
Excellent.
This seems to be a... captain’s log.
SHE PUNCHES UP VLOG FOOTAGE
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 14
Playing recording.
(THE LOG CRACKLES AND OBSCURES SOME WORDS - IN SQUARE
(DISTORT) OK, Clovis, I’1l be up in a minute. - This is the personal log of Ava Carter, head of mineralogical research at the I.M.C. facility Piranesi-1l.
A mining company. Not my favourite people.
(DISTORT) The date is [October 28, 2996,] three months to the day since we started our mission.
Well, that’s not terribly helpful.

(DISTORT) Although it’s still early days, all teams have reported some interesting - and potentially profitable - results. As anticipated from spectroscopic analyses off-world, this planet - designated E.R.M. four-nine-nine-seven - has a highly unique geology, despite its comparative youth in planetary terms.
E.R.M. four-nine-nine-seven. Mean anything to you?
Not the proverbial sausage.

(DISTORT) We anticipate good yields of [trisilicate, limpidium and tetramanganese]. Red Team have reported interesting results with the seams running below Alpha-Lab, and Blue Team's exploration of the cave system suggests this is consistent with the lower strata. This stage of research is budgeted to last for another two trimesters, but projected revenues would seem to justify IMC’s initial investment and point to full-scale planetary excavation going forward.
And yet the whole place is deserted.
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 15
(DISTORT) Despite the loss of [Researcher Jovian in a cave accident last month] -
Loss? Someone died?
Perhaps. Or perhaps someone just flew home?
. morale is holding up well. Rations will get a bit monotonous by the next planet-fall, but none of us signed up for the fine dining! Speaking with some experience, I am confident we can
justify our bonuses this year. Nights are long and...
LOG SQUAWKS AS THE FILES BECOME HEAVILY CORRUPTED, THEN DIES
Hmm. Sounds like that’s it for the moment.
Shame it’s missing key information.
CROSS TO STOD IN THE FOREGROUND
GRUNTING
(DISTANT) Yes. I’m not sure if the files or the system were corrupted, but I could try rebuilding them, with time.
(DISTANT) You might not need it. According to this schematic,
there’s an archive through there. It must have more data!
THEY CROSS THE ROOM, STOD SHUFFLES AWAY
SNUFFLING OFF
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 16
SCENE 7: INT. ARCHIVE ANTE-ROOM
DOCTOR AND MEL ENTER A NEW CHAMBER
Yes, base archive through here.
RATTLES THE HANDLE. NOTHING HAPPENS
Or perhaps not.
MEL TRIES IT
That isn’t just locked, it’s jammed.
And seemingly re-engineered. So it would appear this schematic
doesn’t tell the whole story. What’s actually behind there, I wonder?
HE RUSTLES THE SCHEMATIC
Doctor... what are those dots?
What dots?
Those dots, on the lower levels. They’re moving, ever so slightly.
Yes. In the... (CHECKS MAP) labs. I’d missed them completely.
Life signs?
Possibly. Only one way to find out.
Which is?
Head down and look.
Are you sure? If those dots indicate whatever caused the
emergency in the first place...
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 17

Oh, I’m sure we've nothing to worry about, Mel. The level of sand everywhere, the lack of electricity, the general dilapidation. Whatever happened here happened long ago. And we've no reason to assume it was an act of violence.
It usually is, though.
Given their comparative lack of movement, they might be trapped down there. Maybe a wall collapsed, or the roof caved in. They might be stuck there, slowly starving, awaiting rescue.
I suppose.
We’ve got to look. We don’t have any choice.
As long as we're cautious.
We will be. Now —- there’s a comms system over there. We can let them know we’re coming, tell them hope is on its way!
HE MOVES OFF
Wait, what?
THE DOCTOR OPERATES CONTROLS
Hello? Hello, can anyone hear me...?
CROSS TO:
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 18
SCENE 8: INT. CELLS [CONTINUOUS]
(STETTIMER MUTTERS HIS EPIC IN THE BACKGROUND AS THE DOCTOR’S
MESSAGE CONTINUES OVER THE TANNOY. PARTS ARE
(DISTORTED) This is (CRACKLE) And Mel. (CRACKLE) We’ll be down soon!
THE MESSAGE CUTS OUT
Will you now? And who might you be when you're at home?
Steady on, Clown. You know what they’re like. This could be another test.
Hope springs eternal.
Friends to the rescue? Sounds like wishful thinking.
Ooh, it’s a tough old cosmos you live in isn’t it, matey-bob?
Just seen too much to be positive... When they get here we keep quiet. And initiate Plan D.
I am Stettimer and I will destroy whoever next comes through that door! Great my anger, wide my claw!
Oh strewth.
Save it, Lobster! That isn’t Plan D!
They will rue this dishonour! There will be a reckoning!
I’m sure there will. You won’t be able to move for rueing, lots of reckoning all over the shop.
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 19
Yes, reckoning there will be! But no shops. I am no shopkeeper.
I am Archon...
KETCH/ JACKSON: Stettimer!
We know! Here’s a thing, it could be someone who doesn’t want to kill or torture us. Hows about that?
Ever the optimist, eh, Clown? You remind me... Did I ever tell you about my escape from the Cloud Prisons on Plexaris-9?
Probably.
The Ice Queen had held me captive for fifteen lunar cycles, but
on the sixteenth she made one tiny, but fatal mistake...
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 20
SCENE 9: INT. STAIRWELL
THE DOCTOR AND MEL TRAIPSE DOWNSTAIRS
Don’t you just love a spiral staircase, Mel? So much more exciting than regular stairs.
Whatever you say, Doctor. — So the energy core’s through that wall?
Yes.
Odd to think of all that power flowing past us. Is it much further?
(FADING OFF AS THEY DESCEND) Just another couple of flights...
(THEY VANISH BELOW. AFTER A FEW MOMENTS, STOD FOLLOWS, GRUMBLING AND STUMBLING)
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL)
SCENE 10: INT. CELLS
THE DOCTOR AND MEL ENTER. CRACKLING LIGHTS EVERYWHERE
These don’t look like labs to me...
They look more like cells.
Is it too much to ask that one of these rooms has decent lighting?
THE DOCTOR TAPS CONTROLS
You’re not going to open one of those cells?
Can you think of a better way to discover what’s happening here?
But people in cells are usually dangerous.
Page 21
Nonsense. I’ve been in plenty of cells over the years. And Ima
puppy dog.
You? You’re the most dangerous person I know.
(NOISE FROM STAIRWELL BEHIND - STOD CLAMBERING DOWN AFTER
THEM)
(SOTTO) Doctor... Doctor, I think something followed us. Down
the stairwell.
Not now, Mel, I’ve nearly got this...
(HE FLICKS A SWITCH. THERE’S A SERIES OF CLUNKS. SIMULTANEOUSLY, STOD CHARGES FROM THE STAIRWELL! )
GUTTURAL BATTLE CRY
Something did follow us! Doctor!!!
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 22
THE CLUNKS TURN INTO STETTIMER’S DOOR UNLOCKING AND OPENING
(REALISATION) The cell door’s opening!
I am Stettimer! And this is my reckoning!
HE CHARGES OUT, ATTACKING STOD. HUGE MELEE BREAKS OUT
Get back, Mel! As far as possible!
(RETREATING) What’s happening? It’s too dark to see!
I don’t know. But whatever that thing following us was, the creature in the cell is saving us from it. Or possibly the
other way round...
(THE FIGHTERS SLAM INTO A WALL. A CONTROL SHATTERS. A DOOR
DOWN BEHIND THE DOCTOR, IN FRONT OF MEL, SHUTTING WITH AN ECHOING CLANG)
TRAPPED BEHIND THE DOOR) Doctor! (SHE HAMMERS THE DOOR
One moment!
(THE MELEE SPIRALS OUT OF THE ROOM. THE COMBATANTS TUMBLE DOWNSTAIRS, STILL FIGHTING)
I think we’re clear. They’re taking their disagreement downstairs... Mel? Mel, where are you?
CROSS TO:
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 23
SCENE 11: INT. OTHER HALF OF CELLS, BEHIND DOOR [CONTINUOUS]
MEL’S SIDE OF THE DOOR. SHE HAMMERS ON THE DOOR
Behind this door or wall, or whatever this is! It just appeared out of nowhere!
(MUFFLED) Are you alright?
Yes. The lights are completely out this side, but apart from
that, everything’s fine.
(MUFFLED) It must be a security door. Locks off the cells from the rest of the room. I think those two hit the controls in their melee.
Hence it closing.
(MUFFLED) Yes, the controls are smashed. I’1l have to try releasing you from upstairs.
Well... alright. I suppose it doesn’t seem especially dangerous.
(MUFFLED) I’1l try to get the lights working as well. I'll be as quick as I can!
(ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE DOOR, JUST AUDIBLY, THE DOCTOR'S
RECEDE)
Bye, Doctor. — So much for us coming to the rescue...
NEARBY, KETCH IS WHISTLING
Hello? Is there someone there?
KETCH TAPS THE WALL OF HIS CELL
Hello? I’ll come towards you. Are you hurt? I can’t see very
well... (SHE STUMBLES ALONG) I'll feel my way along the wall. Keep whistling.
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL)
SCENE 12: INT. COMPUTER ROOM
THE DOCTOR RACES IN
Right. Door controls... door controls...
HE FLICKS SWITCHES
Page 24
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 25
SCENE 13: INT. ANTE-CHAMBER BETWEEN CELLS
MEL HAS REACHED KETCH’S CELL
There, that’s it. Are you in there? The door’s locked. Can you hear me? Are you alright?
CRACKLE OVER THE TANNOY
(DISTORTED) Mel? I know you can’t reply, but I’m upstairs. I’m trying to open that shutter. There’s quite a few controls, but none of them are identified. I'll try the lot. Just a matter of
time. When you’re released, find me. Now, maybe if I try... this-
CUTS OFF
(A GRIND OF GEARS. THE CELLS DOORS ALL UNLOCK AND OPEN. THE
SQUEAK PAINFULLY )
Security door, Doctor, not the cell doors!
JACKSON GRABS MEL
Not so fast, you!
Let go of me! I wasn’t doing anything! Fast or otherwise!
Not until we find out who you are...
Oh for goodness’ sakes Jackson, it’s not one of them!
We don’t know that for sure!
Will you get off! (EFFORT)
MEL TRIPS HIM UP. HE FALLS TO THE GROUND WITH A THUD
WINDED
THE LIGHTS COME ON
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 26
Ah, the lights, that’s better, now we can see! What are you doing on the floor, Mr Jackson?
I... fancied a lie-down.
I think it’s best if we keep on our new friend’s good side. - Hello, Miss! Pleasure to make your acquaintance!
(CAREFULLY) And yours...
Easy, Clown! We still don’t know who she is. She’s clearly combat trained...
Hardly! Some self-defence classes at the Village Hall, but I’m no karate kid. My name’s Melanie Bush. I’m here to help.
Yes, we heard your colleague’s message over the comms. I do apologise for my colleague’s manhandling of you. After the time we've had here, we couldn’t take any chances.
Got to have a plan.
Yeah. “Whistle, then we grab her if we can.” Tactical genius, Mr Jackson.
Well, I’ve had warmer welcomes, Mr...?
Forgive me, Miss. Ketch. Godfrey Ketch, all-round entertainer, late of the Galactic Pleasure Cruiser HMSS Unbelievable.
Where have you come from?
Well, Earth originally.
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 27
Ooh — Earth, eh? There’s posh! Slumming it a bit in the Outer Galaxy, aren't we?
You’re a long way from home, Princess. How did you get here?
I’m not a princess. And we’ve still not been properly introduced, Mr Jackson.
Colonel Jackson.
Colonel?
You might have heard of me as “Anvil“ Jackson. I get about a bit.
“Anvil”? That’s an odd name.
Nickname. It’s actually the word for an ancient piece of Earth technology, used in the distant past for hammering nails into wood.
No. That’s a hammer.
A what?
A hammer. Hence ‘hammering’.
Ha! I don’t think so. I’d have to be an idiot not to know the meaning of my own nickname. So, Earth girl, what brings you this far into the Outer Galaxy? You're far beyond Terran jurisdiction here.
I don’t know what you’re taking about. I came here with my friend the Doctor. We answered your distress beacon.
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 28
Distress beacon? What... Who sent you?
Oh give it a rest, lad. I think Ms Bush here is as good as her word. And a personal physician too? Must be handy. Eccentric aristocratic lady on an adventure holiday, is it?
Not exactly.
Explains the clothes.
What’s wrong with my clothes? And he’s not that kind of Doctor.
I... Hang on, there were other life-signs on the schematic. Are there any more of you?
Hah, well I think you met Mr Stettimer on the way in.
Lobster.
Crustacean, two and a half metres tall, fond of poetry. He’s difficult to miss.
Yes... Something jumped us outside, I think he attacked it...
Aha, yes. One of our hosts, perhaps.
Hosts?
He means our jailers.
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 29
SCENE 14: INT. COMPUTER ROOM
THE DOCTOR FLICKING SWITCHES
Surely one of these must work...
HE FLICKS A SWITCH. A DOOR OPENS BEHIND HIM
Ah. So that’s how we get to the archive...
HE HESITATES
Well, if Mel’s shutter hasn’t opened already, she can wait a few more seconds...
(HE HEADS TO WHERE THE DOOR OPENED. AFTER HE’S GONE, A FEW
Incoming spaceship. Prepare docking tube.
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 30
SCENE 15: INT. ANTE-CHAMBER BETWEEN CELLS
MOANS FROM ONE OF THE OTHER CELLS
Sounds like Tethneka’s awake.
Hey, Mother Superior. You in there?
CREAK OF HINGES AS TETHNEKA ENTERS FROM HER CELL
(APPROACHING) Jackson, is that you child?
Miss Tethneka. So glad you’re here. We weren’t sure you'd made it through this time.
I was... meditating. The Seven Spiritual Exercises gave me the strength to withstand the solitary confinement. But who is this?
Ms Melanie Bush. From Earth, no less!
Hello.
Are you a prisoner, too?
No. The princess here has come to rescue us all. She says.
I’m not a — Oh, why won’t you believe me?
Jackson’s heart has weathered much, child. He finds it difficult to trust. But all of us have suffered in this terrible place.
Mr Ketch said you’ve all been imprisoned here.
Indeed. Imprisoned, and worse.
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 31

JACKSON: Not until we find out who you are...
KETCH: Oh for goodness’ sakes Jackson, it’s not one of them!
JACKSON: We don’t know that for sure!
MEL: Will you get off! (EFFORT)
JACKSON: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 26
KETCH: Ah, the lights, that’s better, now we can see! What are you doing on the floor, Mr Jackson?
JACKSON: I... fancied a lie-down.
KETCH: I think it’s best if we keep on our new friend’s good side. - Hello, Miss! Pleasure to make your acquaintance!
MEL: (CAREFULLY) And yours...
JACKSON: Easy, Clown! We still don’t know who she is. She’s clearly combat trained...
MEL: Hardly! Some self-defence classes at the Village Hall, but I’m no karate kid. My name’s Melanie Bush. I’m here to help.
KETCH: Yes, we heard your colleague’s message over the comms. I do apologise for my colleague’s manhandling of you. After the time we've had here, we couldn’t take any chances.
JACKSON: Got to have a plan.
KETCH: Yeah. “Whistle, then we grab her if we can.” Tactical genius, Mr Jackson.
MEL: Well, I’ve had warmer welcomes, Mr...?
KETCH: Forgive me, Miss. Ketch. Godfrey Ketch, all-round entertainer, late of the Galactic Pleasure Cruiser HMSS Unbelievable.
JACKSON: Where have you come from?
MEL: Well, Earth originally.
MEL: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 27
KETCH: Ooh — Earth, eh? There’s posh! Slumming it a bit in the Outer Galaxy, aren't we?
JACKSON: You’re a long way from home, Princess. How did you get here?
MEL: I’m not a princess. And we’ve still not been properly introduced, Mr Jackson.
JACKSON: Colonel Jackson.
MEL: Colonel?
JACKSON: You might have heard of me as “Anvil“ Jackson. I get about a bit.
MEL: “Anvil”? That’s an odd name.
JACKSON: Nickname. It’s actually the word for an ancient piece of Earth technology, used in the distant past for hammering nails into wood.
MEL: No. That’s a hammer.
JACKSON: A what?
MEL: A hammer. Hence ‘hammering’.
JACKSON: Ha! I don’t think so. I’d have to be an idiot not to know the meaning of my own nickname. So, Earth girl, what brings you this far into the Outer Galaxy? You're far beyond Terran jurisdiction here.
MEL: I don’t know what you’re taking about. I came here with my friend the Doctor. We answered your distress beacon.
MEL: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 28
JACKSON: Distress beacon? What... Who sent you?
KETCH: Oh give it a rest, lad. I think Ms Bush here is as good as her word. And a personal physician too? Must be handy. Eccentric aristocratic lady on an adventure holiday, is it?
MEL: Not exactly.
JACKSON: Explains the clothes.
MEL: What’s wrong with my clothes? And he’s not that kind of Doctor.
MEL: I... Hang on, there were other life-signs on the schematic. Are there any more of you?
KETCH: Hah, well I think you met Mr Stettimer on the way in.
JACKSON: Lobster.
KETCH: Crustacean, two and a half metres tall, fond of poetry. He’s difficult to miss.
MEL: Yes... Something jumped us outside, I think he attacked it...
KETCH: Aha, yes. One of our hosts, perhaps.
MEL: Hosts?
JACKSON: He means our jailers.
JACKSON: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 29
JACKSON: SCENE 14: INT. COMPUTER ROOM
DOCTOR: Surely one of these must work...
DOCTOR: Ah. So that’s how we get to the archive...
DOCTOR: Well, if Mel’s shutter hasn’t opened already, she can wait a few more seconds...
DOCTOR: (HE HEADS TO WHERE THE DOOR OPENED. AFTER HE’S GONE, A FEW
MOMENTS PASS THEN: )
COMPUTER VOICE: Incoming spaceship. Prepare docking tube.
COMPUTER VOICE: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 30
COMPUTER VOICE: SCENE 15: INT. ANTE-CHAMBER BETWEEN CELLS
KETCH: Sounds like Tethneka’s awake.
JACKSON: Hey, Mother Superior. You in there?
TETHNEKA: (APPROACHING) Jackson, is that you child?
KETCH: Miss Tethneka. So glad you’re here. We weren’t sure you'd made it through this time.
TETHNEKA: I was... meditating. The Seven Spiritual Exercises gave me the strength to withstand the solitary confinement. But who is this?
KETCH: Ms Melanie Bush. From Earth, no less!
MEL: Hello.
TETHNEKA: Are you a prisoner, too?
JACKSON: No. The princess here has come to rescue us all. She says.
MEL: I’m not a — Oh, why won’t you believe me?
TETHNEKA: Jackson’s heart has weathered much, child. He finds it difficult to trust. But all of us have suffered in this terrible place.
MEL: Mr Ketch said you’ve all been imprisoned here.
TETHNEKA: Indeed. Imprisoned, and worse.
TETHNEKA: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 31
MEL: But why? Who imprisoned you?
KETCH: You don’t know?
JACKSON: You’ve a nasty surprise coming up, Princess...
JACKSON: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 32
JACKSON: SCENE 16: INT. SONTARAN CONTROL DECK
JACKSON: (THE DOCTOR CREEPS IN. THE TECH TICKS OVER GENTLY. IT’S NEWER, AND DISTINCTLY DIFFERENT IN ORIGIN - SONTARAN, NOT HUMAN)
DOCTOR: Hmm. Seems to be a command deck. (BEAT) That technology looks famil(iar) - Oh no...
DOCTOR: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 33
DOCTOR: SCENE 17: INT. ANTE-CHAMBER BETWEEN CELLS
KETCH: Surprised you didn’t run into them upstairs.
TETHNEKA: They are sorry, angry creatures.
DOCTOR: (DISTORTED) Mel! We’re i[n terrible] danger! If the doors aren't open already, when they do, make straight for the TARDIS!
JACKSON: That’s your ship?
MEL: Yes. But ‘danger’?
DOCTOR: (DISTORTED) I found a command deck. It had alien technology wired into its systems, and I recognised which technology!
DOCTOR: Now... maybe this switch -
DOCTOR: (THE DOORS GRIND SOMEWHERE BEHIND. SKEGG MUTTERS IN THE
DISTANCE: )
KETCH: Wrong set of doors, matey-bob. That’s the cells again, not the door to the staircase...
JACKSON: Doesn’t seem too bright for a physician...
MEL: The Doctor’s a genius! If we’re in trouble, he’s the best person to get us out of it.
KETCH: But he might need a locksmith to do it.
MEL: I think it’s the system. Do you know anything [about...]
MEL: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 34
TETHNEKA: Wait! Can you hear, from the punishment cell?
MEL: Punishment cell?
JACKSON: The far end, over there. I think your friend just opened it...
KETCH: You’re right, my dear. Who could that be?
MEL: You don’t know?
TETHNEKA: We were the only prisoners.
JACKSON: Another “rescuer“? Or a trap?
JACKSON: (THEY APPROACH THE PUNISHMENT CELL. THE QUIET GIBBERING ECHOING
FROM: IT GETS LOUDER AS THEY APPROACH)
TETHNEKA: He sounds distressed, whoever it is.
MEL: If you were the only prisoners, who’s in there?
KETCH: That’s what I wanna know.
KETCH: (JACKSON PUSHES IT OPEN. THE DOOR CREAKS. THEY GASP IN SURPRISE AS THE MUTTERING FIGURE IS REVEALED)
MEL: What’s that?
JACKSON: One of our jailers!
SKEGG: Leave me alone! Keep them away from me! I’m scared!
SKEGG: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 35
SKEGG: SCENE 18: INT. COMPUTER ROOM
DOCTOR: Come on, come on -
COMPUTER VOICE: Ship fully docked. Opening airlock.
DOCTOR: What? What ship? Oh, no! Time to hide. Those lockers, I
DOCTOR: think...!
DOCTOR: (HE DIVES INTO A CUPBOARD. TWELVE SONTARANS TROOP INTO THE ROOM)
TROOPER: Entry site secured.
KAYSTE: (OFF) We do not launch distress beacons!
KLATH: (OFF) No, sir, but Central Command were most insistent.
KAYSTE: (OFF) This is an unwarranted intrusion into my mission!
TROOPER: #1: Field-Major Kayste entering. Squad ’shun!
KAYSTE: What a miserable location. Whoever is responsible for this impertinence shall die. And they shall die at my hand! For the
KAYSTE: glory of the Sontaran race!
KAYSTE: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 36

elements.text: PART TWO
OPENING THEME
Field-Major Kayste entering. Squad ‘shun!
THE SONTARANS COME TO ATTENTION AS KAYSTE AND KLATH ENTER
What a miserable location. Whoever is responsible for this impertinence shall die. And they shall die at my hand! For the
glory of the Sontaran race!
CROSS TO:
SCENE 19: INT. CUPBOARD IN COMPUTER ROOM [CONTINUOUS]
THE DOCTOR BREATHES QUIETLY, CLOSE
(MUFFLED) I am needed in the Hammerhead Nebula with the rest of the fleet, not investigating minor situations on backwater planets. At ease!
OUTSIDE THE TROOPS STAND AT EASE
(MUFFLED) Indeed sir, but the distress communication is seen as sufficiently anomalous to warrant investigation.
(MUFFLED) I should lead from the front, Klath, not skulk in the
shadows.
(SOTTO) No, that’s my job. So —- a glory hunter, eh?
CROSS BACK TO:
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 37
SCENE 20: INT. COMPUTER ROOM [CONTINUOUS]
What is this facility? It is not of Sontaran design.
The full briefing is here, sir. (HANDS HIM A REPORT) It is a former civilian mining facility constructed by one of the lesser races. It has been used as a field research station by
the 47°’s Tactical Unit for the last two cycles.
Research Unit? Back office functions? This situation goes from bad to worse. — Hear this. We are to investigate what has

happened to the research team at this facility. I want this Situation expedited as quickly as possible, so mount a full recce and report back at the double. There may be research specimens at large: local resistance is to be met with lethal force. The sun is now setting on this benighted rock. I want to be en-route to the battlefield before it rises again. Dismissed.
12 x SONTARANS: Sir!
Alpha Platoon with me to the upper deck. Beta take this level, Gamma and Delta to the lower levels.
THE TROOPS STOMP OUT
Where is the Control Deck?
This way, sir.
THEY HEAD FOR THE CONTROL DECK. THE DOCTOR CLAMBERS OUT
What’s worse than being stuck in a lift with a Sontaran? Being stuck in a lift with an angry Sontaran who’s not been allowed to the battle...
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 38
SCENE 21: INT. ANTE-CHAMBER BETWEEN CELLS
No! Do not let them get close! Do not let them hurt me!
Now, now. Calm down. We’re here to help.
Are we? I say kill him now. Get it over with.
He is sick. You cannot kill a sick animal.
He’s not an animal, he’s a soldier.
Then where is his uniform? See, he has weaved it into a... quilt? I would wager it is not only his uniform that has unravelled. Can you not see his mind is broken?
Can you not remember him torturing us? Him and his pals?
Torture? He tortured you?
This is Skegg. He was their leader.
Then I admire your compassion, Tethneka.
In my order we take a vow - to care for all sentient life. Whilst I may feel anger, my spiritual exercises give me mental calm.
Oh, please. Clown. Surely you can’t let this monster live?
Can I abstain? I prefer not to get involved in this sort of
thing...
What happened to you, Skegg? Please, tell us.
My crew... my crew went mad!
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 39
SCENE 22: INT. SONTARAN CONTROL DECK
KLATH PUNCHES UP INFORMATION ON THE DECK’S SYSTEMS
This was a standard research unit, Klath? Crew of three:
Tactical Commander, Research Lieutenant and junior officer...
Sir. Skegg, Stod and OverCadet Glarr respectively. Their service records are accessible here.
The Sontaran fleet is vast and glorious. We suffer casualties every day. The greater the odds, the greater the honour. Why then has Central Command sent us to investigate this minor situation?
I believe it is the nature of the communication from this base that focused their attention. With your permission, Field- Major?
Granted.
(KLATH PUNCHES UP GLARR’S MESSAGE ON THE MONITOR. AS WITH CARTER’S LOG, THE QUALITY IS TERRIBLE)
(DISTORT) Here... Do you hear me? They watch us... The shapes,
the colours, the sounds... I... (FORCES HIMSELF TO BE LUCID) This is OverCadet Glarr, late of the 47 reporting. I am calling from tactical research base four-seven-seven oblique stroke
two-point-six. This... This is a terrible place. We should not have come here. I fear for my life... Please help us. I beg you.
BLASTER FIRE AND GUTTURAL LAUGHTER IN THE BACKGROUND
This place has... The others are not as they should be. They have become... tangled. No, unravelled. Twisted. Untwisted. Untwisted. Un... Un... I cannot... I am afraid. No! No! Please!
(THE LAUGHTER AND BLASTER FIRE REACH A CRESCENDO. THE MESSAGE
OUT)
This is... unworthy of a Sontaran officer. Naked fear in the face of adversity? Entreaties for help and clemency? What could cause such mental and moral deterioration?
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 40
Questions Central Command are asking, sir.
Mmm. What about the research stock here? Could one of the specimens account for this? A mental attack of some kind?
According to records... Four are currently under examination. A Losturan - physically capable, but primitive - one human, one human mongrel...
Human?
A level-4 civilisation, gaining some influence in the western quadrant of Mutters Spiral, as yet of only minor tactical
interest. — And one Tellaxi.
Tellaxi... They have mental abilities, do they not? Might that explain this?
Low level telepathy, but nothing which could account for mental degradation on this scale.
So... a mystery. I do not like mysteries.
HIS WRIST COMM BLEEPS
Report, Trooper!
#1: (DISTORTED) Vorn with Alpha Platoon on the upper deck. No signs of recent occupation, sir. But there are traces of blaster
discharge. And... other artefacts.
Artefacts? Explain.
#1: (DISTORT) A blue box, around two metres tall, and two objects. Mineral. Function unclear.
A blue box? Scan for Artron energy in the vicinity. Anything else?
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 41
#1: (DISTORT) Some... pigmentation on the wall. Unknown provenance.
Very good, Trooper. Secure the deck. Await further instruction. Out.
CLOSES THE LINK
These objects may warrant inspection, in the absence of further intelligence.
Perhaps, Klath. Perhaps. But I have a schedule to keep. Let us see what the others find. These are the comms systems?
Patched into the civilian architecture.
KAYSTE FLICKS A SWITCH. HIS SPEECH ECHOES AROUND THE BASE
This is Field-Major Kayste of the Fifth Sontaran Fleet. No matter what may have occurred previously, this facility is now under my jurisdiction.
CROSS TO:
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 42
SCENE 23: INT. ANTE-ROOM BETWEEN CELLS [CONTINUOUS]
(TANNOY) Make no mistake, we will discover what has happened here and neutralise it if necessary. Co-operation is demanded. Resistance is futile. Out.
THE MESSAGE CUTS OUT
Oh dear.
My thoughts exactly, my lady.
Sounds to me like your friend is captured. Maybe even dead.
You don’t know the Doctor. Don’t make any assumptions. If anyone can escape these ‘Sontarans’, it’s him.
THE DOORS START OPENING AROUND THEM
See? He’s trying the doors again.
THE SECURITY DOOR OPENS
And the right one at last!
Then he’s not the only one who's free!
HE RACES FOR THE STAIRS
Where you going?
What? Me? I’m... going to look for the lobster. He’s been gone a while now.
The big creature that leapt out at us?
I suppose ‘big creature’is a relatively accurate description of Stettimer.
The Doctor said he fell downstairs.
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 43
Then downstairs I go! I would say wish me luck, but as you
know, I don’t need luck!
HE RACES OFF
What is he talking about?
Quite a fan of himself is our Mr Jackson.
I see. Well, that’s his biggest mistake. With that door open, we should definitely look for the Doctor.
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 44
SCENE 24: INT. COMPUTER ROOM
THE DOCTOR FLICKING SWITCHES
Please, computer. Just open those doors properly before those Sontarans come back!
2 x SONTARANS APPROACHING FROM OFF
Ah. Well, I’1l just have to hope that was enough. Back downstairs I go.
HE RACES OUT AS KAYSTE AND KLATH RETURN THROUGH OPPOSITE DOOR
This was a mining facility, Adjutant-Commander?
Derelict some eighty years, Field-Major. It was designated as a
suitable location for the 47°’s research needs, being equidistant between...
I don’t need the details, Klath. (REALISATION) This terminal is active. None of our technical staff have been here?
No sir.
And it conspicuously lacks dust, unlike everything else in this squalid hole. Which systems have been accessed? (HE POKES THE TERMINAL) There is a secondary over-ride on the containment network!
The facility’s original control system, sir. It can be over- ridden from our command centre.
Something, or someone has been trying to open the containment cells below! We are not alone, Klath. Whoever has done this
must be nearby...
I will reassign Alpha [Platoon to...]
A WHIRR, THE LIGHTS POWER DOWN
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 45
What? The lights have gone out!
Must be a power cut, sir. The geothermal converter works by -
I do not care how it works, get it fixed! Where is my torch...?
FUMBLES FOR TORCH
(BLEEPS HIS WRIST-COM) Adjutant Commander Klath to landing craft. Send across Chief Technician Gyte -
(CLUNKING IN THE DARKNESS - THE DOOR MECHANISMS RUNNING OF THEIR OWN ACCORD)
Wait!
PAUSE
What was that noise?
Servo mechanisms functioning on residual power? Temperature
differentials...
I will not wait in the darkness listening to conjecture!
LIGHTS WHIRR ON AGAIN
Ah! The lights...
THEY WHIRR OFF AGAIN
..are off again.
LIGHTS WHIRR ON AND OFF
This is intolerable. I will be on the Control Deck.
Sir, the door mechanism may be affected by the power shortages
too...
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 46
(ROARS ANGRILY. THUMPS THE HALF-OPEN DOOR) Help me prise it open, then!
THE DOOR MECHANISM GRINDS AS THEY FORCE THE DOOR. CROSS TO:
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 47
SCENE 25: INT. BASE UPPER LEVEL [CONTINUOUS]
TROOPER 1 OPERATES WRIST COM
#1: Trooper Vorn reporting from observation deck, Field-Major.
(WALKING — DISTORT) Report.
The box shows high deposits of Artron energy, sir. We have attempted to open it, but it appears impervious to non- specialist equipment.
(WALKING — DISTORT) Understood. Watch it for the time being, and ensure the upper deck is secured. Anything more?
#1: The lighting and power systems are failing, sir. Night has fallen.
(WALKING — DISTORT) We are aware of the situation. Guard that box, darkness or no, trooper. I will inspect it myself shortly. Kayste out.
THE TRANSMISSION ENDS. CROSS TO:
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 48
SCENE 26: INT. SONTARAN CONTROL DECK [CONTINUOUS]
KAYSTE AND KLATH WALK IN
You suspect the presence of the Time Lord known as the Doctor, Field-Major?
The blue box makes it likely, Klath. You have read the briefings. If he is involved, that complicates matters. We must devise a suitable strategy.
I will prepare an intelligence report on his last known activities in this sector. His appearance is always a variable parameter, however.
The Doctor is famed for his duplicity, Klath. It must be expected.
GYTE ENTERS
Chief Technician Gyte reporting, sir.
Ah, Gyte. We are beset by power and lighting failures. Deal with them.
At once, sir.
I will confirm identification of the Time Lord’s transportation device.
(KAYSTE AND GYTE HEAD FOR THE DOOR. THERE IS A WHIRR. THE
POWERS UP AGAIN TEMPORARILY. THE DOOR CLUNKS BACK SHUT)
What is happening?
The door system appears affected too, sir.
HE PRODS THE DOOR CONTROL
I cannot open it, sir.
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 49
(ENRAGED) Does nothing work in this accursed place? Klath, we require aid!
THEY STRAIN TO OPEN THE DOOR MANUALLY. EVENTUALLY SUCCEED
(LEAVING) If I find the Doctor is behind this,
I will crush the life from him with my bare hands!
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 50
SCENE 27: INT. STAIRWELL
(THE DOOR OPENS. MEL STEPS OUT. STEPS ARE COMING DOWN THE
TOWARDS THEM, BUT STILL QUITE DISTANT)
Right, the last we heard from the Doctor, he -
Someone’s coming!
Quick, back inside!
(THEY DART BACK IN AND CLOSE THE DOOR. EVENTUALLY, THE STEPS
LOUDER. THE DOCTOR APPEARS )
(WHISPER) Mel? Mel, are you there?
ANOTHER SOUND BREEZES AROUND HIM:
UNINTELLIGIBLE WORDS, WHISPERED
That’s not Mel.
(THE NOISE COALESCES INTO A MORE DISTINCT ‘GHOST’. AVA CARTER
PAST, LIGHTLY)
(JUST AUDIBLE) We really must look into that second seam
properly...
You! You're... what was it, Ava Carter? Yes, Ava Carter, head of research. I thought you were dead.
SHE’S GONE AWAY DOWNSTAIRS
No, don’t go! Wait for me!
(HE FOLLOWS HER. SILENCE ON THE STAIRWELL FOR A FEW MOMENTS. THEN THE DOOR IS OPENED. MEL STEPS OUT, TETHNEKA AND KETCH BEHIND)
Right, the coast’s clear. Whoever was out here, they’ve gone.
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 51
You will return shortly?
Yes. Look after Skegg. We’ll get help.
MEL AND KETCH CLIMB
Where exactly are we headed?
If I know the Doctor, he’ll have made for the TARDIS! Come on. Upstairs!
THEY CLAMBER UP
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 52
SCENE 28: INT. SONTARAN CONTROL DECK
KLATH WORKS THE TERMINAL. THE DOOR OPENS. GYTE ENTERS
Ah, Gyte. The power supply appears to have stabilised. Good work.
Thank you, Commander Klath. I have fixed the geothermal energy relay. But the entire system requires an overhaul.

I understand this research post was to be temporary. The 47™ may have underestimated the level of dereliction. It appears to have infected the Sontaran systems too. (PRODS THE TERMINAL) I am trying to locate Commander Skegg’s research notes on this terminal, but they appear inaccessible. See what you can find, Gyte. I will join Field-Major Kayste on the Upper Deck.
Sir.
KLATH GOES
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 53
SCENE 29: INT. BOTTOM OF STAIRWELL/CAVES
THE DOCTOR REACHES THE CAVES. HIS VOICE ECHOES
Hmm. These’ll be the caves then. Miss Carter? Miss Carter!
NO REPLY
Where did she get to?
HE MOVES INTO THE TUNNELS
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 54
SCENE 30: INT. OBSERVATION DOME
KAYSTE AND THREE SONTARANS MARCH IN
Yes, Trooper. That is the Doctor’s time capsule. We must keep our wits about us.
#1: Sir.
And this is the pigmentation on the wall you reported? Curious. The shape is familiar. It seemingly represents an exploding Rutan battle-cruiser, cursed be their tentacles.
#1: I had not realised that, Field-Major, but now...
I am a veteran of far more engagements than you, Trooper. There

is evidence of mental imbalance in this facility’s former crew. This crude attempt at graphic representation may be symptomatic of that. The pigment used... (HE SCRATCHES SOME PAINT, TASTES IT) Does this taste familiar?
#1: (SCRATCHING AND TASTING) Blood, sir.
Sontaran blood. This is a grave business, Trooper.
KLATH ENTERS
Commander Klath reporting, Sit...
Ah, Klath. Observe the image on the wall here...
THE LIGHTS CUT OUT WITH A WHIRR
Accursed lighting system!
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 55
SCENE 31: INT. SONTARAN CONTROL DECK
TERMINAL BEEPS
Ah. The research notes. Accessing...
(DISTORT) The cells are full of nightmares. My heart is full of
care. I walk in lonely caverns...
Is this... encoded?
WHIRR OF ANOTHER POWER FAILURE
Another power failure? The lights?
(DISTORT) A stranger on the stairs... (CHUCKLES) The words make patterns in my mind... Stairs, cares, shares, dares...
ANOTHER METALLIC CLUNKING, AS BEFORE
Who is there? No-one. The servo-mechanisms are operating
independently. They must be slaved [to...]
(DISTORT) Watch over your shoulder, wander in the dark. Dark,
mark, dark... (CHUCKLES)
METALLIC CLUNKING GETS CLOSER
There must be an over-ride for the door servos... here.
(HE PUNCHES ANOTHER CONTROL. IT SHORTS, SENDING A SHOCK THROUGH HIM, STUNNING HIM)
Aaargh!
HE SLUMPS ONTO THE TERMINAL
(DISTORT) The shadows in the dark, the watchers in the clouds...
CUTS OUT IN STATIC
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 56
SCENE 32: INT. CAVES
THE DOCTOR STUMBLES ALONG
Miss Carter? Where are -
STUMBLES OVER SOMETHING
Oof. What on Earth did I just -?
HE CROUCHES. JACKSON EMERGES
Mind that dead Sontaran.
Yes, so it is. And you are?
Colonel Anvil Jackson. You must be Melanie’s phy- no, you're not her physician, are you? I know —- you’re her butler!
Sometimes it feels that way.
Those creatures were keeping us prisoner. But you got us free, well done.
Ah. I did open the right door in the end, that’s good to know.
(MUSING) So the Sontarans upstairs weren't the first to arrive on this base. But what killed our friend here, I wonder?
LIFTS A FEW LIMBS. LET’S THEM DROP
Judging by those claw marks on his face, reckon my crustacean chum was responsible. He was the first one you let out of the cells.
So this Sontaran was the creature following me and Mel when we
first arrived? It was so dark at the time, I couldn't tell.
I came down here to find him.
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 57
If this is his handiwork, are you sure that’s wise?
Can you think of someone better to have on your side? What
about you? Why are you here?
Oh, I followed a ghost. I think.
CARTER’S VOICE ECHOES DISTANTLY WITHIN THE CAVES
This way -
I think we should go... in that direction...
HE HEADS OFF
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 58

KLATH: too...
KLATH: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 46
KAYSTE: (ROARS ANGRILY. THUMPS THE HALF-OPEN DOOR) Help me prise it open, then!
KAYSTE: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 47
KAYSTE: SCENE 25: INT. BASE UPPER LEVEL [CONTINUOUS]
TROOPER: #1: Trooper Vorn reporting from observation deck, Field-Major.
KAYSTE: (WALKING — DISTORT) Report.
TROOPER: #1:
TROOPER: The box shows high deposits of Artron energy, sir. We have attempted to open it, but it appears impervious to non- specialist equipment.
KAYSTE: (WALKING — DISTORT) Understood. Watch it for the time being, and ensure the upper deck is secured. Anything more?
TROOPER: #1: The lighting and power systems are failing, sir. Night has fallen.
KAYSTE: (WALKING — DISTORT) We are aware of the situation. Guard that box, darkness or no, trooper. I will inspect it myself shortly. Kayste out.
KAYSTE: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 48
KAYSTE: SCENE 26: INT. SONTARAN CONTROL DECK [CONTINUOUS]
KLATH: You suspect the presence of the Time Lord known as the Doctor, Field-Major?
KAYSTE: The blue box makes it likely, Klath. You have read the briefings. If he is involved, that complicates matters. We must devise a suitable strategy.
KLATH: I will prepare an intelligence report on his last known activities in this sector. His appearance is always a variable parameter, however.
KAYSTE: The Doctor is famed for his duplicity, Klath. It must be expected.
GYTE: Chief Technician Gyte reporting, sir.
KAYSTE: Ah, Gyte. We are beset by power and lighting failures. Deal with them.
GYTE: At once, sir.
KAYSTE: I will confirm identification of the Time Lord’s transportation device.
KAYSTE: (KAYSTE AND GYTE HEAD FOR THE DOOR. THERE IS A WHIRR. THE
SYSTEM: POWERS UP AGAIN TEMPORARILY. THE DOOR CLUNKS BACK SHUT)
SYSTEM: What is happening?
GYTE: The door system appears affected too, sir.
GYTE: I cannot open it, sir.
GYTE: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 49
KAYSTE: (ENRAGED) Does nothing work in this accursed place? Klath, we require aid!
KAYSTE: (LEAVING) If I find the Doctor is behind this,
KAYSTE: I will crush the life from him with my bare hands!
KAYSTE: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 50
KAYSTE: SCENE 27: INT. STAIRWELL
KAYSTE: (THE DOOR OPENS. MEL STEPS OUT. STEPS ARE COMING DOWN THE
STAIRS: TOWARDS THEM, BUT STILL QUITE DISTANT)
MEL: Right, the last we heard from the Doctor, he -
KETCH: Someone’s coming!
MEL: Quick, back inside!
MEL: (THEY DART BACK IN AND CLOSE THE DOOR. EVENTUALLY, THE STEPS
GET: LOUDER. THE DOCTOR APPEARS )
DOCTOR: (WHISPER) Mel? Mel, are you there?
DOCTOR: That’s not Mel.
DOCTOR: (THE NOISE COALESCES INTO A MORE DISTINCT ‘GHOST’. AVA CARTER
WALKS: PAST, LIGHTLY)
CARTER: (JUST AUDIBLE) We really must look into that second seam
CARTER: properly...
DOCTOR: You! You're... what was it, Ava Carter? Yes, Ava Carter, head of research. I thought you were dead.
DOCTOR: No, don’t go! Wait for me!
DOCTOR: (HE FOLLOWS HER. SILENCE ON THE STAIRWELL FOR A FEW MOMENTS. THEN THE DOOR IS OPENED. MEL STEPS OUT, TETHNEKA AND KETCH BEHIND)
MEL: Right, the coast’s clear. Whoever was out here, they’ve gone.
MEL: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 51
TETHNEKA: You will return shortly?
MEL: Yes. Look after Skegg. We’ll get help.
KETCH: Where exactly are we headed?
MEL: If I know the Doctor, he’ll have made for the TARDIS! Come on. Upstairs!
MEL: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 52
MEL: SCENE 28: INT. SONTARAN CONTROL DECK
KLATH: Ah, Gyte. The power supply appears to have stabilised. Good work.
GYTE: Thank you, Commander Klath. I have fixed the geothermal energy relay. But the entire system requires an overhaul.
KLATH: I understand this research post was to be temporary. The 47™ may have underestimated the level of dereliction. It appears to have infected the Sontaran systems too. (PRODS THE TERMINAL) I am trying to locate Commander Skegg’s research notes on this terminal, but they appear inaccessible. See what you can find, Gyte. I will join Field-Major Kayste on the Upper Deck.
GYTE: Sir.
GYTE: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 53
GYTE: SCENE 29: INT. BOTTOM OF STAIRWELL/CAVES
DOCTOR: Hmm. These’ll be the caves then. Miss Carter? Miss Carter!
DOCTOR: Where did she get to?
DOCTOR: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 54
DOCTOR: SCENE 30: INT. OBSERVATION DOME
KAYSTE: Yes, Trooper. That is the Doctor’s time capsule. We must keep our wits about us.
TROOPER: #1: Sir.
KAYSTE: And this is the pigmentation on the wall you reported? Curious. The shape is familiar. It seemingly represents an exploding Rutan battle-cruiser, cursed be their tentacles.
TROOPER: #1: I had not realised that, Field-Major, but now...
KAYSTE: I am a veteran of far more engagements than you, Trooper. There
KAYSTE: is evidence of mental imbalance in this facility’s former crew. This crude attempt at graphic representation may be symptomatic of that. The pigment used... (HE SCRATCHES SOME PAINT, TASTES IT) Does this taste familiar?
TROOPER: #1: (SCRATCHING AND TASTING) Blood, sir.
KAYSTE: Sontaran blood. This is a grave business, Trooper.
KLATH: Commander Klath reporting, Sit...
KAYSTE: Ah, Klath. Observe the image on the wall here...
KAYSTE: Accursed lighting system!
KAYSTE: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 55
KAYSTE: SCENE 31: INT. SONTARAN CONTROL DECK
GYTE: Ah. The research notes. Accessing...
SKEGG: (DISTORT) The cells are full of nightmares. My heart is full of
SKEGG: care. I walk in lonely caverns...
GYTE: Is this... encoded?
GYTE: Another power failure? The lights?
SKEGG: (DISTORT) A stranger on the stairs... (CHUCKLES) The words make patterns in my mind... Stairs, cares, shares, dares...
GYTE: Who is there? No-one. The servo-mechanisms are operating
GYTE: independently. They must be slaved [to...]
SKEGG: (DISTORT) Watch over your shoulder, wander in the dark. Dark,
SKEGG: mark, dark... (CHUCKLES)
GYTE: There must be an over-ride for the door servos... here.
GYTE: (HE PUNCHES ANOTHER CONTROL. IT SHORTS, SENDING A SHOCK THROUGH HIM, STUNNING HIM)
GYTE: Aaargh!
SKEGG: (DISTORT) The shadows in the dark, the watchers in the clouds...
SKEGG: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 56
SKEGG: SCENE 32: INT. CAVES
DOCTOR: Miss Carter? Where are -
DOCTOR: Oof. What on Earth did I just -?
JACKSON: Mind that dead Sontaran.
DOCTOR: Yes, so it is. And you are?
JACKSON: Colonel Anvil Jackson. You must be Melanie’s phy- no, you're not her physician, are you? I know —- you’re her butler!
DOCTOR: Sometimes it feels that way.
JACKSON: Those creatures were keeping us prisoner. But you got us free, well done.
DOCTOR: Ah. I did open the right door in the end, that’s good to know.
DOCTOR: (MUSING) So the Sontarans upstairs weren't the first to arrive on this base. But what killed our friend here, I wonder?
JACKSON: Judging by those claw marks on his face, reckon my crustacean chum was responsible. He was the first one you let out of the cells.
DOCTOR: So this Sontaran was the creature following me and Mel when we
DOCTOR: first arrived? It was so dark at the time, I couldn't tell.
JACKSON: I came down here to find him.
JACKSON: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 57
DOCTOR: If this is his handiwork, are you sure that’s wise?
JACKSON: Can you think of someone better to have on your side? What
JACKSON: about you? Why are you here?
DOCTOR: Oh, I followed a ghost. I think.
CARTER: This way -
DOCTOR: I think we should go... in that direction...
DOCTOR: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 58
DOCTOR: SCENE 33: INT. OBSERVATION DOME
KLATH: But the lights should be working, Field-Major! Gyte assured me he had fixed the geothermal energy relay.
KAYSTE: Then Gyte will be disciplined for this intolerable inefficiency!
KLATH: The servo-mechanisms appear to be...
KAYSTE: Trooper. Ensure the door at the foot of the stairs does not clamp shut. I will not be trapped up here.
TROOPER: #1: Sir.
TROOPER: (SNAPS TO ATTENTION, THEN STUMBLES TO THE STAIRCASE. MORE
MECHANICAL: CLUNKING)
TROOPER: #2: What was that? I heard something in the darkness!
TROOPER: #3: Ah! I am under attack!
TROOPER: #2: Unhand me, scum!
TROOPER: #3: Face the might of the Sontaran Empire!
KAYSTE: What is happening? Are we under attack?
KAYSTE: (TROOPER #2 AND #3 GRUNT AS THE FIGHT GETS NASTY. A BLASTER IS DISCHARGED. THE LIGHTS WHIRR ON)
KAYSTE: Lights, at last! Cease fire! Cease fire! Where is the enemy?
KLATH: There is none... We appear to have been fighting ourselves.
KLATH: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 59
KAYSTE: The Alpha Platoon? Brawling like an untrained rabble? You should recognise your comrades by night and day, not fall over each other at the first opportunity! Get out of my sight. I will draw up disciplinary charges later.
KAYSTE: This mental deterioration seems contagious.
KAYSTE: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 60
KAYSTE: SCENE 34: INT. STAIRWELL
KETCH: My legs are my best feature, you see, Melanie. Besides my arms. It’s because of my upbringing. Human mother. Indeterminate alien father. Means my limbs can contort beyond usual human limits. Like this. (GRUNTS OF EFFORT) There you go, a sausage
KETCH: dog... flamingo... [flock of geese... I
MEL: Quiet, Ketch! - Hear that?
KETCH: They're coming this way!
MEL: Back downstairs. Let’s hope they’re heading for the control room...
MEL: (THEY HEAD BACK A FEW STEPS. THE SONTARANS TROOP PAST INTO THE
CONTROL: ROOM. KAYSTE AND KLATH AT THE REAR)
KAYSTE: I require the aid of Beta Patrol. They are made of stronger
KAYSTE: stuff than these reprobates...
KLATH: I understand...
MEL: Come on...
MEL: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 61
MEL: SCENE 35: INT. SONTARAN CONTROL DECK
KAYSTE: Technician Gyte! This is not the time for sleep!
GYTE: (REVIVING) Wha... Uh, Field-Major!
KAYSTE: Snap to it, man!
GYTE: Sir!
KAYSTE: Explain yourself!
GYTE: I was accessing research notes on Commander Klath’s orders, Sir:
KAYSTE: After you had “fixed” the power relay on this level, yes?
GYTE: Sir. There must have been further damage to the system. It gave
GYTE: me an electric shock and rendered me unconscious. There was...
KAYSTE: Was it the system or your own incompetence that incapacitated you, eh? I am meant to be commanding an elite unit!
GYTE: Sir...
KAYSTE: More excuses?
GYTE: The research notes from the log.
KAYSTE: What of them?
KAYSTE: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 62
KAYSTE: SCENE 36: INT. OBSERVATION DOME
MEL: Here we are, the viewing dome. The TARDIS landed in the next room...
KETCH: Had to sort out a cabaret once for a court of Algurian nobles. Not a chuckle all night. Found out later from an exobiologist that the only thing they laugh at is different shades of the colour brown. I should have told the chef to burn the fish,
KETCH: they'd have had hysterics.
MEL: Come on, Ketch, don’t dawdle! I know it’s a lovely view but don’t get distracted...
KETCH: These Sontarans don’t have much of a sense of humour, either. They threatened to kill me. I told them I died every night for a month at the Betelgeuse Palladium. They didn’t get it.
MEL: Hold on. (STOPS)
KETCH: Something the matter?
MEL: Those statues. I could swear they’ve changed shape. Or moved...
KETCH: This place does odd things to the mind. The only thing that changes shape here is me!
MEL: What?
KETCH: My contortionisms entertained rulers across the eight galaxies. Or was it nine galaxies? It was more than three certainly.
MEL: Let’s just get to the TARDIS.
MEL: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 63
KETCH: You don’t believe me? Watch and wonder... I am very bendy...
MEL: Are you feeling alright?
KETCH: No, actually. It’s a bit stuffy in here, isn’t it? I think we need air.
MEL: What?
KETCH: One of those sculptures should make a good crack in the dome if
KETCH: you swing it right...
KETCH: (HE MOVES FOR A STATUE. MEL GRABS HIM. IN THE BACKGROUND, THREE
SONTARANS: APPROACH FROM DOWNSTAIRS )
MEL: No! The air out there, it isn’t good for us!
KETCH: Nonsense! Let go of me!
TROOPER: #4: No. Let go of each other.
MEL: Oh great.
MEL: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 64
MEL: SCENE 37: INT. SONTARAN CONTROL DECK
GYTE: That is all the contents of the log, Field-Major.
KAYSTE: This doggerel conforms to no ciphers I recognise. Although this was an intelligence unit... (PAUSE) I do not know what is
KAYSTE: occurring here, Technician, but I do not like it. And we certainly cannot expedite this investigation with a fluctuating power supply. Fix it. Properly this time. Dismissed.
GYTE: Sir.
KAYSTE: (TO COM) Report.
KLATH: (DISTORTED) Klath, sir. Beta Platoon apprehended two aliens on the observation deck. They have brought them to the COMPUTER ROOM. Do you wish to interrogate them?
KAYSTE: Yes. (WRIST COM BLEEPS OFF) The first good news I’ve had all day.
KAYSTE: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 65
KAYSTE: SCENE 38: INT. COMPUTER ROOM
KETCH: Sounds like we get to meet the big cheese, then.
MEL: I wonder if he’ll be in a better mood than this lot.
KLATH: Silence, scum!
KLATH: Field-Major Kayste on deck!
KAYSTE: At ease.
KETCH: Oh, I’m always at ease, sonny Jim.
KLATH: I said silence! (HE CLOUTS KETCH)
KETCH: Ow!
MEL: Don’t treat him like that!
KLATH: You speak when you are spoken to!
KAYSTE: These are two of the research specimens, Klath?
KLATH: Sir. According to the records, these must be the mongrel...
KETCH: (SOTTO) Charming...
KLATH: ...and warrior-class human.
KLATH: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 66
MEL: (SOTTO) Does he mean me?
KETCH: (SOTTO) Mr Jackson must have boasted on his application form.
KAYSTE: The humans? Even without seeing the results of Commander
KAYSTE: Skegg’s work, I think it unlikely either poses a threat to our glorious war-machine. Identify yourselves, tell me what happened to the research team and your part in it. Be brief and specific.
MEL: Why should we help you?
KETCH: Your deaths will be shorter.
KETCH: Well that’s quite an enticement isn’t it, Ms Melanie?
MEL: We don’t know what happened. We’re as much in the dark as you are.
KETCH: We were only let out of our cells just now. Your chum Mr Skegg was carrying out his duties quite happily till then, I assure you.
KAYSTE: You observed Commander Skegg during his research?
KETCH: Oh yes. We had a jolly old time together. Can’t say I got to know him well, but he seemed to be enjoying himself.
KAYSTE: This man is an idiot. Sontaran military research is not meant to be a pleasurable experience, especially for captive specimens.
KETCH: Each to his own, matey.
KETCH: Ow!
KETCH: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 67
KLATH: You will show respect to a Sontaran officer!
MEL: We’ve told you all we know! Stop hitting him!
KAYSTE: You pleading is pathetic. You are the warrior-class human?
MEL: I’m not a warrior.
KAYSTE: Is there a mistake in the records, Klath? This is a human, is it not?
KLATH: Yes, Field-Major.
KAYSTE: Wait. These two were found on the Upper Deck, near to the
KAYSTE: Doctor’s time capsule?
KLATH: Yes sir.
KAYSTE: What do you know of the Doctor?
KETCH: Not sure about “the” Doctor. Could do with “a” Doctor, mind, the way my lumbago’s been playing up...
KAYSTE: Are you the Doctor?
KETCH: Well, they do say laughter is the best medicine.
MEL: (DESPERATE) No! No, he’s not!
KAYSTE: But you know who is?
KAYSTE: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 68
KAYSTE: You do not answer. Your silence betrays you.
MEL: I won’t help you. You'll have to kill me.
KAYSTE: You forget. I can resume where Commander Skegg left off. This is a fully functioning facility for testing the durability of lesser races to physical and mental attack. I can wrack your body and mind with the most terrible pain, and I will do so until you lead me to the Doctor.
MEL: I’11 never do that.
KAYSTE: You show courage. Or stupidity. I will enjoy finding out which.
TROOPER: #5: Field-Major! Trooper Vard reporting. We found two more. The
TROOPER: Tellaxi [and -]
SKEGG: Don’t take me upstairs! No further! (WAILS)
KAYSTE: Great Sontar!
KLATH: Commander Skegg!
TETHNEKA: Your comrade is unwell. You should help him.
KAYSTE: Silence, alien scum! (HE GRABS SKEGG) You will cease this
KAYSTE: noise!
SKEGG: Don’t let it... Down in the dark... It... (SOBS QUIETLY)
KAYSTE: Control yourself!
KAYSTE: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 69
KAYSTE: Klath, secure these prisoners. I will take Commander Skegg to the Control Deck for interrogation. Move!
SKEGG: (GOING) No! Let me go! Don’t make [me -]
SKEGG: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 70
SKEGG: SCENE 39: INT. SONTARAN CONTROL DECK
SKEGG: (DOOR HISSES OPEN. KAYSTE FLINGS SKEGG INTO THE ROOM. THE DOOR
HISSES: SHUT. SKEGG MANAGES TO STOP SOBBING AS KAYSTE STALKS
AROUND: HIM)
KAYSTE: I see from your insignia that you hold the rank of Tactical Commander.
SKEGG: That was... before...
KAYSTE: Silence! You may not interrupt an officer of senior rank! What has happened to the rest of your uniform, the rest of your research team? Account for yourself!
KAYSTE: How dare you sit before your superior! You forget yourself! To your feet! You dishonour your uniform and clone batch.
SKEGG: My... clone batch?
KAYSTE: You record states you served five tours in the Intelligence Corps before taking over this facility?
SKEGG: Batch... Catch, hatch, latch...
KAYSTE: What is this gibberish? Do you take me for a fool? I can have you executed without legal process if I find evidence of dereliction of duty. And from the sorry remains of this facility I find evidence of gross dereliction.
SKEGG: Dense. Density. Destiny. De de de de...
KAYSTE: You shame your fallen comrades with your feeble-mindedness and irrationality!
SKEGG: The fallen? Yes, the fallen. If I should fall... I should fall deep and far.
SKEGG: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 71
KAYSTE: Do you refer to the lower levels? Your work in the cells?
SKEGG: Below the surface, in the dark. In the walls...
KAYSTE: What happened to the rest of your crew? Where is OverCadet Glarr, who sent out that thoroughly dishonourable distress beacon? The Rutan scum would laugh at us - had they mouths - if they intercepted such a call. Have you nothing to say?
SKEGG: The... clouds. They scare me.
KAYSTE: How dare you! A Sontaran knows no fear! No terror! And you slump there babbling inanities!
KAYSTE: I will throttle the life from you myself, you weak-minded coward!
KAYSTE: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 72
KAYSTE: SCENE 40: INT. COMPUTER ROOM
TETHNEKA: (SOTTO) They found us in the cells. We had little option but to accompany them.
MEL: (SOTTO) It couldn’t be helped.
KETCH: (SOTTO) They can be persuasive.
MEL: (SOTTO) Are you alright, Mr Ketch? They didn’t hit you too hard?
KETCH: (SOTTO) Hard enough, my dear, but I’1l live.
TETHNEKA: (SOTTO) I thought they would have cared for one of their own in distress. Is that not the prerogative of all civilised race?
KLATH: Silence! The prisoners are not to confer!
GYTE: Technician Gyte reporting, Commander. I have secured the power relays. But an important route for the power goes through the mining control here. I can make the door systems function properly if I restart them here.
KLATH: Proceed.
GYTE: I am... unfamiliar with human technology. Its primitive configuration is confusing compared to the elegance of Sontaran systems.
KETCH: Oh, a fellow artiste!
KLATH: That was the last time you speak, mongrel.
KLATH: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 73
KETCH: Yargh!
KLATH: I will tear you limb from limb.
MEL: Stop! Don’t hurt him!
KLATH: Why shouldn’t I?
MEL: Because... Because I’m a computer programmer. I can help with the systems. And I will. If you let him go.
KLATH: You are lying to save your comrade.
MEL: No really, I was working on that terminal before! I’1l show your technician. Just stop hurting Mr Ketch.
KLATH: Show Technician Gyte. Trooper, cover her.
MEL: Ok, I’m going. (SHE CROSSES OVER) Here. It’s a hexadecimal control code. (PUNCHES THE KEYS) There, we can start rebuilding the command system...
GYTE: And trace where the power outlets are shorting. Excellent!
GYTE: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 74
GYTE: SCENE 41: INT. TUNNELS
JACKSON: Urgh... that smell...
DOCTOR: Yes. It looks like that Sontaran wasn’t the only dead thing down here. Must be the original crew...
JACKSON: You’re not going further in?
DOCTOR: Interesting... you see the gems in the wall?
JACKSON: The what? - Oh, yeah.
DOCTOR: They look to be the same colour as the clouds outside.
JACKSON: The look to be valuable, more like...
JACKSON: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 75
JACKSON: SCENE 42: INT. COMPUTER ROOM
GYTE: What is this switch?
CARTER: (MONITOR) This is Ava Carter! Mayday, I repeat Mayday.
MEL: It’s the log left by the original crew. I tried to access it before.
CARTER: (DISTORT) I have sent out a distress beacon on all known
CARTER: frequencies, but I think it’s too late.
KLATH: This may be relevant to the current situation.
CARTER: (DISTORT) The events of the last few days have driven us to the
CARTER: edge of madness and beyond. I’ve just sealed half my crew in the caves, after they tried killing the rest of us. The others are upstairs in the observation deck, worshipping the stones. We knew what we were doing when we signed up but none of our training prepared us for any of this. — We kept seeing shapes in things. Patterns. Our thoughts were not our own. Then the arguments. The fights, the rioting... (PAIN) There’s a blizzard in my head! We thought we were experimenting on the rocks; but the rocks were experimenting on us! I... I am leaving the base. Going outside. Clear my thoughts. My thoughts fly up... The clouds... I... must...
MEL: Those poor people.
KLATH: The human mind is primitive and clearly susceptible.
TETHNEKA: Did you see your colleague Skegg?
TETHNEKA: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 76
KETCH: If there’s something in the water we’ve all been drinking it,
KETCH: matey...
KETCH: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 77
KETCH: SCENE 43: INT. TUNNELS
CARTER: (GHOSTLY) Take the stones.
DOCTOR: Did you hear that?
CARTER: (GHOSTLY) Take the stones!
JACKSON: I hear everything. My senses are honed to the highest degree. What was it?
DOCTOR: A voice.
JACKSON: No, didn’t get that.
DOCTOR: The gems... they want me to take them. Remove them from the wall!
JACKSON: Well, why not? They'll be worth a pretty penny...
JACKSON: (HE STARTS PULLING GEMS OUT. THERE’S AN ORGANIC GRINDING NOISE IN THE WALL - REMINISCENT OF THE DOOR MECHANISMS, BUT MORE
SQUELCHY: )
DOCTOR: What was that?
JACKSON: Sounded a bit like the grinding in the walls upstairs. Happens
JACKSON: from time to time.
DOCTOR: That’s not mechanical, that’s something else.
JACKSON: Some... thing?
DOCTOR: (TO WALL) What are you?
DOCTOR: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 78
DOCTOR: (THE NOISE GROWS LOUDER, SQUELCHY, POLYPS PULSING, MINERAL
SEAMS: SHIFTING)
SEAMS: Are you trying to tell me something?
JACKSON: What are you on about, talking to the wall?
DOCTOR: Quiet! There’s something else in here.
DOCTOR: There, in the wall, I can feel it. Growing, changing, about to burst through. Something alive in the walls. - What do you want?
DOCTOR: (THE GRINDING REACHES A CRESCENDO. A CACOPHONY OF SOUNDS ORGANIC, ELECTRONIC AND SUBTERRANEAN )
JACKSON: Doctor! Doctor, what’s happening!
DOCTOR: Argh! It’s in my mind! (CRIES OUT IN PAIN)
DOCTOR: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 79

elements.text: PART THREE
OPENING THEME
THE ORGANIC SCRAPING AND GRINDING IN THE WALL GETS LOUDER
There, in the wall, I can feel it. Growing, changing, about to burst through. Something alive in the walls. -— What do you want?
(THE GRINDING REACHES A CRESCENDO. A CACOPHONY OF SOUNDS ORGANIC, ELECTRONIC AND SUBTERRANEAN )
Doctor! Doctor, what’s happening!
Argh! It’s in my mind! (CRIES OUT IN PAIN)
SCENE 44: INT. TUNNELS
(TO SELF) Seems like you need rescuing, old feller. I’ve got more than enough of these diamond things...
