DOCTOR: Ah, glad you could join us! Gyte, I assume? Power relays fixed?
GYTE: Someone recalibrated the thermal relays. I now see who...
JACKSON: (LEAPING OUT) Recalibrate this, you monster!
DOCTOR: Jackson, no!
DOCTOR: (JACKSON STABS GYTE IN THE VENT WITH HIS LASER CUTTER. GYTE
DIES: HORRIBLY )
GYTE: Aaargh!
GYTE: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 101
JACKSON: Said I’d come back. There — laser cutter, right in that vent. Found it in the stores. Thanks for that neck tip, butler. This
JACKSON: guy’s not getting up again.
DOCTOR: I thought you’d knock them out, not stab them in the back!
JACKSON: Too late for games, butler. It’s payback time. Now, this one I recognise...
DOCTOR: Jackson, no! There’s been enough killing for one day!
JACKSON: Hey, this guy tortured me for a month!
DOCTOR: Be that as it may, look at him now! Is that the face of your
DOCTOR: torturer? There’s something at work here, not just the Sontarans — can’t you see it?
JACKSON: What I can’t see is how any of this is my problem. We need to get out of here. You’ve got a ship, haven't you?
DOCTOR: We can’t leave.
JACKSON: My laser cutter says we can. Unless you want to argue with it.
JACKSON: Leave Skegg. So he’s learned to knit. Big whoop. We are leaving. Now.
JACKSON: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 102
JACKSON: SCENE 56: INT. ATRLOCK
JACKSON: (MEL IS AT THE DOOR CONTROL, KETCH STARTS RANSACKING A LOCKER. THE DUST CLOUD OUTSIDE IS GATHERING)
KETCH: Maybe there’s something in these lockers... Ah, respirators! Bit vintage, but better than nothing! How are you doing with that door, Ms Melanie?
MEL: I think I’ve found the over-ride sequence.
KETCH: Good-o. I don’t like the look of that dust cloud. (COUGHS) Think it’s seeping in. Miss Tethneka, don’t stand there, you'll choke!
TETHNEKA: Lis;
MEL: Let’s see if I’m right...
MEL: There! That’s the over-rides gone! We might be able to open it by hand!
KETCH: Righty-ho! Think my bendy limbs might come in useful here, if we both have a go!
MEL: Tethneka! Give us a hand. Come on, it’s nearly open!
TETHNEKA: Yes. Let me...
KETCH: Shake a leg! That’s it, now...
KETCH: (TETHNEKA ADDS HER WEIGHT. THE DOOR OPENS FURTHER. SHE SLIPS
PAST: THEM AND GOES OUT)
KETCH: There you go, Tethneka, my dear! You’re through! Now use the control and let us out!
KETCH: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 103
KETCH: Agh!
MEL: Ow! No, Tethneka. You’re locking it again! What are you doing?
KETCH: Can’t you hear us? What’s wrong with her? (HE THUMPS AT THE GLASS OF THE DOOR)
MEL: She’s smiling! Why...?
KETCH: First time I’ve seen her do that for a while...
MEL: Forget her! The dust cloud’s here!
MEL: Grab a respirator!
MEL: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 104
MEL: SCENE 57: INT. OBSERVATION DOME
MEL: (JACKSON AND THE DOCTOR ENTER. THE THREE SONTARANS MARCH AROUND
MADLY: )
DOCTOR: (HUSHED WHISPER) Sontarans, keep back!
TROOPER: #4:
TROOPER: (REPEATS THROUGHOUT, UNDER) Left and right and one and two. Left and right and left and slide. Left and right and step, ball change. Shuffle. Hands. And again.
JACKSON: (SOTTO) Well that’s odd.
DOCTOR: (SOTTO) Sontaran drill patterns aren’t usually this elaborate. Or... dance based.
JACKSON: (SOTTO) They’ve lost it! They’ve completely lost it.
DOCTOR: (SOTTO) That’s what I’ve been trying to tell you! Look at the
DOCTOR: shapes they’re making, the shapes of the statues, the shapes in the dust outside.
JACKSON: (SOTTO) I’m looking. I’m not seeing.
DOCTOR: (SOTTO) They may be abstract, but they’re remarkably similar wouldn’t you say? Something is manipulating us all. Making us behave erratically, and these shapes are our attempts to control the madness. There is an intelligence that exists beneath our feet and in the air outside.
JACKSON: (SOTTO) None of this makes me think of intelligence, butler.
JACKSON: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 105
JACKSON: SCENE 58: INT. SONTARAN CONTROL DECK
KETCH: (DISTORT) Tethneka, why are you doing this?
KAYSTE: See, Klath. The spies betray one another!
MEL: (OVER MONITOR) Ignore her! Put this on or we’ll both choke!
KAYSTE: This lack of moral fibre amongst the lesser races is sickening.
KLATH: Sir, the channel outside the airlock. The Tellaxi appears to be Signalling us.
KAYSTE: Switching comms channel.
TETHNEKA: (OVER MONITOR) - is escaping! Do you hear me, Sontarans? The Doctor is about to escape in his craft!
KAYSTE: What? Switching to upper deck!
KAYSTE: (THE MONITOR IS SWITCHED TO THE PIRHOUETTING SONTARANS IN THE
UPPER: DECK. KAYSTE HISSES IN FURY)
KAYSTE: What is this ridiculous display?
KLATH: Sir! In the corner! That must be the Doctor and another human!
KAYSTE: (STABS CONTROLS) Beta squad! Attention! Cease prancing this instant! The Doctor is there! I will join you. Kayste out.
KLATH: Sir, surely you should remain here to oversee...
KAYSTE: Do not command me, Klath! You are perilously close to a charge of insubordination!
KAYSTE: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 106
KLATH: Sir! I meant no such thing. I will remain here and oversee operations.
KAYSTE: Better. Consider this a warning. Now to apprehend the Doctor myself!
KAYSTE: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 107
KAYSTE: SCENE 59: INT. OBSERVATION DOME
KAYSTE: (THE SONTARAN DRILL CONTINUES, REPEAT OF THE SAME WORDS AS BEFORE, UNDER: )
DOCTOR: (SOTTO) They haven’t spotted us yet. If we’re quiet and careful, we might just get past them. Doesn’t look they’re paying much attention to Kayste’s orders...
JACKSON: (SOTTO) Doesn't matter if they do. Look! I think one of them’s dropped a blaster. I might just be able to reach it.
DOCTOR: (SOTTO) Maybe it was Skegg’s. When he lost his mind and started on the sculptures. (REALISATION) Odd shape, aren't they? They rather resemble those gems you found...
JACKSON: (SOTTO) Really? (PATS HIS POCKETS) Actually, that’s a point, where are my gems?
DOCTOR: (SOTTO) Never mind your gems now.
JACKSON: (SOTTO) I’ve lost them!
DOCTOR: (SOTTO) You’re better off without them. We’ve got more pressing concerns.
JACKSON: (GETTING LOUDER) You might have, I don’t! I must have lost them when I attacked that Technician. (LOUD) Blast it!
TROOPER: #4: What is that -— [sound?] Humans!
DOCTOR: Ah. Well, it appears they’ve noticed us now...
DOCTOR: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 108
DOCTOR: SCENE 60: INT. COMPUTER ROOM
SKEGG: Now I am free from this chair... I can hide in the dark again... Feel the patterns around me.
SKEGG: Wait... I hear you again! I can touch your thoughts in my mind!
SKEGG: Such patterns... There you are! A gemstone? What are you doing on the floor? A gemstone. A gemstone for me? Not a thought. How
SKEGG: did you get up here? How did you...?
SKEGG: I can feel you drawing me... upstairs? No, too many there. Not safe. Outside! Yes, outside! You want to be with the clouds, don’t you? Make new patterns, new colours. I will take you there. I will take you... New patterns, new colours... New shapes...
SKEGG: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 109
SKEGG: SCENE 61: INT. ATRLOCK
SKEGG: (MEL AND KETCH WEAR RESPIRATORS. THE DUST CLOUD GATHERS SPEED IN THE BACKGROUND )
KETCH: (MASK) These’ll help us breathe a bit. What’s Tethneka doing?
MEL: (MASK) She seems to be talking to someone? On the CCTV?
KETCH: (MASK) Can you over-ride the lock again?
MEL: (MASK) Not if she’s on the other side with the control panel. Why’s she done this?
KETCH: (MASK) She’s an odd-un and no mistake.
MEL: (MASK) Wait, there’s someone else there now - (GASPS) A Sontaran!
SKEGG: Yes, my gemstone, my beautiful perfect gemstone, I shall take you to meet the dust cloud! The colours will be brilliant!
MEL: (MASK) Quickly, get out before she can close it again!
SKEGG: Out of the way, human!
KETCH: (MASK) Oof, no need to barge me out the way, you’re welcome, mate.
MEL: (MASK) Mr Ketch, get to [the...]
MEL: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 110
KETCH: (MASK) Locked out. Great. Ms Melanie? Can you hear me? — Evidently not.
SKEGG: (LEAVING) Yes, you will be free, your thoughts will fly with the clouds, I step into the heart of the cloud...
KETCH: (MASK) Come on Ms Melanie! Let me out! The cloud, it’s - agh.
KETCH: It’s dragging me outside! Come on, bendy limbs, just... just brace yourself on the door frame - do your thing! Ms Melanie! Please! It’s tearing my skin!
KETCH: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 111
KETCH: SCENE 62: EXT. DUST-CLOUD [CONTINUOUS]
SKEGG: Stone, I hear your voice - and others - so many voices whirling and singing around me, singing such colours, weaving such patterns in the clouds. You fill my eyes, my mouth, I choke,
SKEGG: but such joy at you... In my hand, stone, you... you... blossom?
SKEGG: But you are so beautiful now! Sprouting... sprouting... so... beauti- Aargh!
SKEGG: (THE STORM SUBSIDES SOMEWHAT AS THE GEMSTONE CONTINUES TO SPROUT WITH A HORRIBLE STONE-LIKE NOISE. SKEGG FALLS. CROSS
TO: )
TO: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 112
TO: SCENE 63: INT. ATRLOCK [CONTINUOUS]
KETCH: (MASK) Oh, my good Lord. Ms Melanie? The storm might be dying, but so’s that Sontaran. He’s face down in the seaweed... it’s... it’s dissolving him. He’s... Something’s growing, Ms Melanie! Growing out of the cloud, and up the dome! Ms Melanie! Ms Melanie, please! I want to get out of here!
KETCH: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 113
KETCH: SCENE 64: INT. OBSERVATION DOME
TROOPER: #4: Open fire!
JACKSON: Don’t worry, butler, I’ve got the gun!
DOCTOR: No! Don’t shoot, Jackson! The last thing we want to do is damage that dome!
JACKSON: Sorry! Can’t hear you!
JACKSON: (HE OPENS FIRE. MASSIVE FIRE-FIGHT; THE BLASTS STRIKE THE DOME,
WHICH: CRACKS)
DOCTOR: Stop it, Jackson! There’s something out there, some kind of plant! It’s growing!
DOCTOR: Well, it’s inside now! Keep away from the fronds! The flowers!
TROOPER: #4: Die, human scum!
JACKSON: Who cares? It’s not interested in us, it seems to like those statues!
DOCTOR: (WORRIED REALISATION) Not just the plant, the cloud likes them
DOCTOR: too... They're part of the same organism! Everyone, keep away from the statues!
JACKSON: What in - what’s happening?
DOCTOR: The frond’s integrated with the statues and the cloud’s triggered their transformation.
DOCTOR: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 114
JACKSON: Into what?
JACKSON: (THE STATUES BUBBLE ORGANICALLY AND START TO MOVE, POLYPS BURSTING. THEIR VOICES RESEMBLE THE ORGANIC SOUND FROM SCENE 43 [AS WITH POSSESSED TETHNEKA IN NEXT SCENE] )
THING: #1: We... live...
THING: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 115
THING: SCENE 65: INT. CORRIDOR OUTSIDE AIRLOCK
MEL: Please, Tethneka! Let Mr Ketch in. The dust cloud will kill him!
TETHNEKA: You are concerned for him...
MEL: Let me open that door. (GRABS TETHNEKA) Please, I don’t want to hurt you!
TETHNEKA: (GRAPPLING) You are spirited, child.
MEL: (GRAPPLING) And you’re stronger than you look!
TETHNEKA: (GRAPPLING) Yes. (LAUGHS) So you must try harder.
MEL: (GRAPPLING) What? Are you enjoying this? This isn’t a game!
TETHNEKA: (GRAPPLING) No.
MEL: Argh! What’s happened to you?
MEL: Your eyes! They're changing colour!
TETHNEKA: (HER VOICE ALTERS, GAINING THE ORGANIC QUALITY IN PREVIOUS SCENE) Now! We live! We awake!
TETHNEKA: TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL)

elements.text: PART FOUR
OPENING THEME
LAUGHS
Your eyes! They’re changing colour!
(HER VOICE ALTERS) Now! We live! We awake!
SCENE 66: INT. CORRIDOR OUTSIDE AIRLOCK [CONTINUOUS]
Who are you? What are you?
Page 116
We are The Bloom. We have waited in the dark, but now we taste
the light.
The Bloom? Then where’s Tethneka?
We use the shape of Tethneka to talk with you now. The dust
cloud outside, that is a part of us too...
The cloud? You mean (REALISATION) Look, it’s dragging Mr Ketch out! Please, let me close the airlock door, he’ll be killed!
We will not stop you...
Good! Now... Argh!
TETHNEKA HAS GRABBED MEL’S HAND
If you take us to the Doctor.
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 117
Let go of me!
We have tasted his thoughts and we find them... rich.
Your grip, it’s so strong! — Alright, I’m sure he’ll want to meet you too. But let me save Mr Ketch first.
Very well.
TETHNEKA RELEASES HER
Thank you. Now...
SHE PRESSES THE DOOR CONTROLS, INTENSELY
That’s the outer door sealed. If I unlock the inner...
You will not release the other creature. The deal was to save
his life. Not let him out.
Why?
Alone you are weaker. Together you may threaten me...
We’re not your enemies!
All are my enemies.
CRACKLE AS THE COMMS WORK
(MASK + DISTORT) Ms Melanie? Ms Melanie! I’ve got the comms working! Can you hear me?
Can I at least talk to him?
TETHNEKA GRABS HER ARM
Argh!
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 118
You will be quick. Then we will go...
Ow! You needn’t to be so rough! (SHE STRAINS, HITS THE COMM BUTTON) Mr Ketch?
(MASK + DISTORT) Hello my dear! What’s up with Miss Tethneka?
Something’s possessed her. Her eyes went all... iridescent. Like the dust-clouds. It’s something to do with them...
(MASK + DISTORT) Most likely. I saw the most rum occurrence with Mr Skegg and those clouds.
Is he dead?
(MASK + DISTORT) Some sort of tendril sprouted out of the rock
he was holding. Now he’s dissolving into the sea-weed.
Those multi-coloured patches I saw with the Doctor... Definitely dead then.
(GRABBING HER AGAIN) The Doctor. You will take us to him...
Ow! I can’t talk anymore, Mr Ketch. If you’re OK, I’1l come back later.
(MASK + DISTORT) What? You’re leaving me in here? Lord, so Miss Tethneka’s taken a leaf out of the Sontarans’ book, has she? Strewth, I...
TETHNEKA SMASHES THE COMM
Enough. We will go.
SHE PULLS MEL AWAY
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 119
Oof. Alright, alright I’m going!
I hear his thoughts above us...
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL)
SCENE 67: INT. OBSERVATION DOME
THE SILICON LIFE ADVANCES
#1: What are these creatures?
#2: Let us examine them.
Fascinating. Some kind of mineral life-form.
#4: What must we do? Kill the humans or kill these... things?
Might I suggest those things? If I’ve got any say in the matter.
#1: What manner of creature are you?
THEY ADVANCE ON TROOPER 4, HE FIRES AT THEM REPEATEDLY
#4: No! Stay back!
#2: What is it trying to do?
#4: Keep away!
#1: We must understand how you work.
THING 1 TEARS HIM APART
#4: Argghh!
#6: Open fire!
THE SONTARANS START BLASTING THE THINGS
Page 120
(UNTROUBLED) Interesting. Their flesh is weak. It rips easily.
Its body armour! They tore through it like paper!
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page
And him. I suspect retreat is our optimum strategy.
Can we get to your ship?
Only if you want to go through the middle of that!
#6: Die, rock scum!
#1: This experiment is useful. We should continue...
Yeah, maybe not. (CALLING) Now you spuds know what it feels like to be lab specimens!
Don’t provoke them! Back downstairs.
THEY MOVE - BUT KAYSTE APPEARS FROM THE STAIRS
Going somewhere, Doctor?
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 122
SCENE 68: INT. CAVES
A TROOPER MARCHING
#1: (PUSHING HIS WRIST-COM) Trooper Vorn reporting. Cave system is secured. Little to report. I await further instruction. Over.
(WRIST-COM BLEEPS) That I should miss the battle for this... point duty. (HIS COMM BLEEPS) Ah! Vorn here! Wh...
A ROAR BEHIND. A MASSIVE FIGURE SWOOPS OUT AND ATTACKS HIM
Aaargh!
Taste my claws, egg-man!
KEFF MCCULLOUGH SYNTH STING
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 123
SCENE 69: INT. OBSERVATION DOME/STAIRS
THE BATTLE CONTINUES IN THE BACKGROUND
I am right, am I not? You are the Doctor?
And you are Field-Major Kayste.
You know my name. So you have been spying on us, Time Lord. As befits your cowardly species.
Hardly. You Sontarans are rather fond of announcing yourselves at any given opportunity. I could have been three planets along and still heard who you were.
Disguise your fear as mockery all you wish, it will not save you.
You don’t scare us, Sont[aran-]
Silence, human!
KAYSTE HITS JACKSON
Ugh!
HE FALLS BACK
Jackson!
Do not worry, Time Lord. He is not dead. Yet. He merely sleeps. (CALLING) Troopers. Disengage!
#6: Field-Major?
We must regroup and decide upon tactics.
I’m not sure you can fight those things.
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL)
Page 124
We can fight anything, Doctor. It is whether or not we die that
is in question. (CALLS) Disengage and retreat!
#6: Sir!
THE SONTARANS STOP FIRING AND RUN OUT
#1: No! Don’t go!
#2: Not when we’re having fun!
THE THINGS HEAD FOR THE STAIRS
GROANING, COMING ROUND
Down the stairs, Doctor.
I’m not leaving Jackson.
Trooper, seal the dome.
No, [wait!]
#6: Sir.
HE HITS CONTROLS. THE DOOR CLOSES
You can’t leave Jackson in there, not with those...
I can, and I have. — The Computer Hub, now! Move!
on the spot!
things!
Or I kill you
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 125
SCENE 70: INT. OBSERVATION DOME
THE MINERAL CREATURES SHAMBLE TOWARDS JACKSON
(COMING ROUND) Ugh... what time is it? Where am I? Aargh! My
nose...
#1: What is it? What does it do?
#2: Let us taste its thoughts...
No! Get away from me! No!!!
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 126
SCENE 71: INT. COMPUTER ROOM
THE DOCTOR AND KAYSTE ENTER
Let Jackson out of the Dome, or I won’t help you.
You have unusual ideas about what I will or will not do.
Field-Major, I am receiving strange reports. What is happening on the observation deck?
I am as yet unsure.
MEL AND TETHNEKA ENTER FROM THE AIRLOCK CORRIDOR
Doctor!
Mel! — Mel, what’s wrong with your friend?
Nothing is wrong with me. Everything now is right.
Yes, I’m not so sure about that. Doctor - I have to tell you what happened to Skegg -
What are you apes wittering about? What is wrong with the Tellaxi?
Judging by the colour of her eyes, I suspect she’s part of the organism attacking us.
I am no mere organism. I am the Bloom.
Pleased to meet you.
It is true?
Oh, pay attention, can’t you?
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 127
If it is she who wages war upon my people, then she shall depart this world, swiftly and permanently.
I really wouldn’t try that.
And yet another presumes to give me orders!
The girl is right. I am but part of a greater whole, you cannot harm me. But I can harm you.
I would like to see you try.
Don’t tempt her.
I can flood this base with the cloud. It would be the work of moments to make you one with us.
Your threats do not work. ‘If we do not let you kill us, you will kill us’, that is no ultimatum. Klath - !
We have no desire to kill you. Just... absorb you. Use you as catalysts in our development as an organism.
Tell that to the Sontarans you ripped apart upstairs.
We... dissected them. For scientific study.
And Jackson? Tell me you’ve left him alone.
Jackson is unharmed physically. Listen.
SHE FLICKS A CONTROL SWITCH. THE FEED FROM THE DOME EMANATES
(DISTORT) Fronds like glass... Living glass... Touching my face... Touching my mind... You, you... So cold, so...
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 128
(DISTORT) Tell us what you are? You are frailer than the other flesh-things here...
CROSS INTO OBSERVATION DOME
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 129
SCENE 72: INT. OBSERVATION DOME [CONTINUOUS]
I am Colonel Anvil Jackson! Space adventurer and...
#2: Its thoughts are clouded, let us search deeper.
Aaagh! (PAIN, THEN TRANCE-LIKE) My name is Dave Jackson. I
worked for Goldthwaite and Zagron Interplanetary Haulage Ltd... So many bodies in the dark!
#1: It has deeper thoughts, memories it fears.

(STILL TRANCE-LIKE BUT EMOTION BREAKING THROUGH) Extra cash for cargo. Smuggling. Didn’t ask questions... What was in the containers? People in the hold. Bodies in the dark. So many, so many, all because of me!
#2: Such rich thoughts, such deep colours...
(TRANCE) I’m sorry! I’m so so sorry! I didn’t know, I didn’t want
to know... Police! Feds after me, across the inner galaxy. Got to get further out. Escape. The darkness. See their faces in the dark. Telling stories. Have to tell my own instead. The
Sontarans believe me. Warriors they understand... A warrior! But I’m no hero...
CROSS BACK TO:
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 130
SCENE 73: INT. COMPUTER ROOM [CONTINUOUS ]
KAYSTE AND THE DOCTOR WATCH JACKSON REMOTELY
(ON SCREEN) Not a hero... Not a hero...
KAYSTE SWITCHES IT OFF
He communicates with the mineral creatures.
A confession, it seems. Was your order big on penitence,
Tethneka? If there’s any of Tethneka left in there?
There is a seam of Tethneka in us. But we are always changing.
Yes. Feeding off all that’s happening around you. Like a newborn learning about its surroundings. Only you’re not a newborn baby, you're a newborn species!
There is much we can learn from you Doctor. Your thoughts, your
mind, so rich...
I suppose I should be flattered. But believe me, there’s a lot in my head you don’t want to see.
The Time Lords have nothing to teach us, cowards to a man!
You Sontarans excite us. But you are... limited.
How dare you!
But within this one, there is much more for us to learn. Down
below, your mind tasted so... complex.
I think I see how this all fits together...
More Time Lord lies! I should tear you limb from limb!
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 131
Oh, can’t you do anything apart from threaten people? This
creature’s already tearing your troops limb from limb, apparently, we hardly need you doing it as well!
Insolence! You will be first!
Think, Kayste! Think! You’re a Sontaran warrior, but you’re
intelligent too! An officer! You’re meant to be brains as well as brawn!
You insult me further, sir?
Field-Major... With respect...
Silence, Klath! (HE BLASTS KLATH)
Sir! I... (HE EXPIRES)
What did you do that for?!
What... Klath? I...
You’ve just shot your Adjudant, Kayste! Is your mind working as rationally as it should be?
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 132
SCENE 74: INT. OBSERVATION DOME
JACKSON BREATHING RAGGEDLY
No hero...
We have learnt all we can from this one. He must become one with the bloom.
THE ORGANIC GROWTH SOUND BURSTS ALL OVER JACKSON
Yaaargh!
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 133
SCENE 75: INT. COMPUTER ROOM
Doctor! Tethneka’s smiling again. I don’t think that’s a good Sign.
(TO TETHNEKA) This is what you want, isn’t it, Bloom? Conflict, violence, surging emotions - they’re intoxicating you!
Klath, I am sorry. Klath! - You, Tellaxi, rock-thing or whatever you are, you will pay for this!
HE GRABS FOR HER
Kayste, no! That’s what she wants - or thinks she wants. Control yourself!
She can still flood the base with the dust-cloud, remember.
(RESTRAINT) Enough! Very well. Stalemate. What is to be done? No answer, Tellaxi? (PAUSE) Time Lord?
Mel, what were you saying about what happened to Skegg?
That coward...
Mr Ketch told me - he was killed carrying a rock into the dust
cloud - it “sprouted” into a tendril or something...
That’s what burst into the dome. So that’s what the “gemstones” were. Parts of a larger organism... like eggs, or seeds. Except
you've used the people here to carry your seeds from the mineral seams below into the atmosphere above.
Like the “sculptures” upstairs!
Yes, colonies of cells... Or perhaps coral polyps would be a better analogy. And the dust-cloud pollinates them!
TERROR OF THE SONTARANS by Dorney & Starkey (FINAL) Page 134
Like plants... made of stone?
